channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Power outages and canceled flights as winter storm brings snow, sleet and ice
item.description: Reporters from across the NPR Network are covering the storm in each state — the impact and how officials are responding.
item.content:encoded:
Reporters from across the NPR Network are covering the storm in each state — the impact and how officials are responding.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Why de-escalation training and communication matters when federal agents police city streets
item.description: The third Minneapolis shooting in three weeks has renewed questions about immigration agents' role, training, and use of force. We put these questions to Chuck Wexler, executive director of the Police Executive Research Forum.
item.content:encoded: The third Minneapolis shooting in three weeks has renewed questions about immigration agents' role, training, and use of force. We put these questions to Chuck Wexler, executive director of the Police Executive Research Forum.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Videos challenge the Trump administration's account of the Minneapolis killing
item.description: Videos and eyewitnesses appear to contradict the Trump administration's account of the Minneapolis killing, prompting accusations of excessive force and state concerns about a federal investigation they say is excluding them.
item.content:encoded: Videos and eyewitnesses appear to contradict the Trump administration's account of the Minneapolis killing, prompting accusations of excessive force and state concerns about a federal investigation they say is excluding them.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Democrats say they cannot back DHS funding after the Minneapolis killing
item.description: A fatal shooting by a Border Patrol agent in Minneapolis is threatening to derail a DHS funding package and push Congress closer to a partial government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: A fatal shooting by a Border Patrol agent in Minneapolis is threatening to derail a DHS funding package and push Congress closer to a partial government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Videos and eyewitnesses refute federal account of Minneapolis shooting
item.description: Trump officials have called the victim a "domestic terrorist." State officials warn such unfounded accusations threaten the integrity of the federal investigation.
item.content:encoded:
Trump officials have called the victim a "domestic terrorist." State officials warn such unfounded accusations threaten the integrity of the federal investigation.

(Image credit: Zaydee Sanchez for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Senate Democrats and Republicans call for investigation into killing of Alex Pretti
item.description: Sen. Tina Smith, D-Minn., accuses the federal government of a 'cover up,' and Sen. Thom Tillis, R-N.C., warns White House against attempts to "shut down an investigation."
item.content:encoded:
Sen. Tina Smith, D-Minn., accuses the federal government of a 'cover up,' and Sen. Thom Tillis, R-N.C., warns White House against attempts to "shut down an investigation."

(Image credit: Adam Gray/AP)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Watch: Videos refute DHS account of fatal shooting in Minneapolis
item.description: Federal officials described the fatal shooting of a 37-year-old U.S. citizen by a federal agent as an act of self-defense. The video evidence that has surfaced so far contradicts that assertion.
item.content:encoded:
Federal officials described the fatal shooting of a 37-year-old U.S. citizen by a federal agent as an act of self-defense. The video evidence that has surfaced so far contradicts that assertion.

(Image credit: Abbie Parr)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: The latest in the shooting of Alex Pretti by a Border Patrol agent in Minnesota
item.description: Tensions in Minneapolis have increased after the death of Alex Pretti. Local law enforcement say federal officers are keeping them from investigating his shooting by a Border Patrol agent.
item.content:encoded: Tensions in Minneapolis have increased after the death of Alex Pretti. Local law enforcement say federal officers are keeping them from investigating his shooting by a Border Patrol agent.
item.dc:creator: Peter Cox

item.title: Minnesota Senator Tina Smith on the immigration crackdown and shooting of Alex Pretti
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with Minnesota Senator Tina Smith about yesterday's fatal shooting in Minneapolis by a Border Patrol agent and the continued immigration crackdown in the city.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with Minnesota Senator Tina Smith about yesterday's fatal shooting in Minneapolis by a Border Patrol agent and the continued immigration crackdown in the city.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: National Park Service dismantles slavery exhibit in Philadelphia
item.description: The National Park Service has removed exhibits depicting slavery and George Washington's treatment of enslaved people at the President's House in Philadelphia.
item.content:encoded: The National Park Service has removed exhibits depicting slavery and George Washington's treatment of enslaved people at the President's House in Philadelphia.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt
